item.title: Highlighting services during closure
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
By default, the library already offers many services where the location of the user is not an obstacle. For example, we provide online access to many articles and ebooks. We also provide support and consultations via email, phone, or Zoom. In light of the lengthy buildings closure during the COVID-19 ...

Read moreHighlighting services during closure

item.title: Student IT Support expert page
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
There’s another update to the ongoing project to emphasize human-centered service in the Library. The Tech Commons has always provided IT support to students, but it was listed as just one of several things offered in that space. After talking with the Help Desk staff about the kinds of questions ...

Read moreStudent IT Support expert page

item.title: Mobile apps: Improving the User Experience
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
As some of you are aware, not all of our databases and journals are available to library users as a mobile device app. Because mobile apps are more complicated to authenticate than the web version of the same content, some don’t work for institutional users (i.e. those who want to ...

Read moreMobile apps: Improving the User Experience

item.title: Now Hiring: Makers Lab Technician
item.dc:creator: Dylan Romero
item.description:
The Library is hiring for a Makers Lab Technician position. If you know of anyone with experience in educational technology with an emphasis on emerging tech, design, or crafts, please encourage them to apply. The full-time position will provide technical support for the Makers Lab, guiding UCSF community members to ...

Read moreNow Hiring: Makers Lab Technician

item.title: On Meeting With Experts and Searching for Library Services
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
A staffer reached out to the web team to let us know they’d had a hard time finding out how to book a consultation with a librarian (or topic expert) at our web site. We know that a lot of our most crucial content isn’t very easily found, and the ...

Read moreOn Meeting With Experts and Searching for Library Services

item.title: Easier formatting in Zendesk
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description: For all you support agents, answering tickets just got a little easier. Zendesk now provides a basic formatting toolbar instead of using Markdown. This image highlights some features, but you will get a chance to use it on your next ticket.

item.title: Zendesk is mobile too!
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
We’ve been using ZenDesk as our support platform for a little while now, so I wanted to remind everyone that it’s also mobile friendly. Library users can easily contact us from a mobile phone or tablet — no app needed. They also have a chance to get their answer from ...

Read moreZendesk is mobile too!

item.title: Zendesk: It’s official!
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
Our trial is coming to a close, and over the last week we’ve been gathering feedback from all support agents.  A clear majority gave Zendesk the thumbs up, so we will be making it our official support platform as of September 29! Some of our agents shared: It’s been great – ...

Read moreZendesk: It’s official!
